Company Description by the company:
About Tricor Systems Inc.

TRICOR System Inc. is a progressive high tech small business that provides reliable high quality hardware and software products to a variety of customers.

TRICOR has gained a reputation for innovative design by producing patentable products on a contract basis. TRICOR's engineers meld electronics, mechanics and optics to produce unique and specialized equipment. The majority of TRICOR's products have been developed for testing and quality assurance functions in the military, medical, switch, food and light measurement industries. Expertise also includes contract manufacturing for the medical, military and industrial markets.

TRICOR chocolate temper meters have become the World Standard. Its switch test and life cycle products are proceeding down a similar path and its surface analysis systems and light measurement equipment are emerging with new photometers, haze and DOI meter measurement instruments.

Company Description by the company:
Since its inception in 1970, Simplex System Controls, a family-run business, has maintained a strong history of providing high-quality custom electrical and pneumatic control panels at a fair price. Barrett Gleixner purchased Simplex in 1983 from his childhood friend Julio Sparacino. Simplex was a source of great pride for Barrett, a family-man, who kept his children, and even grandchildren involved in the business. He built Simplex on the principles of integrity, trust, and loyalty to his customers, vendors, and employees.

In 2008, Barrett sold the business to his daughter, Lianne Sundberg, and her husband, Kurt. Lianne grew up in Simplex with first-hand experience of the company's inner workings, while Kurt brought his prior business management experience to the table. Together, this power duo has established Simplex as a premium supplier to customers across industry lines, while continuing Barrett's vision of a highly principled approach to business. Simplex continues to be a leader More... in the control panel industry. Less

Company Description by Thomasnet: Manufacturer of thermostatic control valves and actuators. Washdown stations, hoses, guns, enclosures, and tepid water systems are offered. Custom thermal bypass valves and actuators are provided. Contract manufacturing services for printed circuit board (PCB) assemblies are available. Types are single or double-sided, metal core insulated, rigid-flex, multilayer, lead-free, conformal coated, surface mount, and through-hole or mixed technology printed circuit boards (PCB). Electro-mechanical assembly, turnkey solutions, testing, and final packaging services are also offered. Other products include thermometers, strainers, and unions. Prototypes, short or long run, and low to high production volumes are available. Serves electronics, medical, railroad, commercial, LED lighting, plumbing, aerospace, and defense industries. RoHS and REACH compliant. AS9100D certified.
Company Description by the company:
For 40 years, ThermOmegaTech has been a leader in designing and manufacturing self-actuating temperature control valves and actuators. We serve many and, as a result, create solutions for a wide range of applications.

Beginning as the developer of highly reliable and cost-effective freeze valves for the railroad industry in 1983, ThermOmegaTech now provides the standard in freeze protection valves for the industry and takes pride in protecting billions of dollars of equipment annually.

In addition to solutions for the railroad industry, ThermOmegaTech's thermostatic valve and thermal actuator technology are used in Commercial Plumbing, Aerospace & Defense, and Industrial applications where temperature control is critical.

These applications include freeze protection, scald protection, steam traps, steam tracing, thermal relief, mixing & diverting, cooling fluid control, thermal bypass, thermal balancing, drain tempering, tepid water delivery, and many other applications where ambient, fluid, More... or surface temperatures affect a system.

 Our mixing valves designed for hot/cold water and steam/water applications have been incorporated into Washdown Stations for industrial cleaning, Instantaneous Hot Water Heaters, and Tepid Water Delivery Systems for safety showers and combination face/eyewash stations.

 In 2018, we expanded into the Electronics Contract Manufacturing market by acquiring a local PCB contract manufacturer, IMET Electronics Corporation. Then in 2019, we acquired a second manufacturer, TJM Electronics, and recently merged both brands into ThermOmegaTech.

 Over the past four years, we have invested many resources into our Electronics Division to learn about the industry and our customers from the 30+ years of PCBA experience our employees have had. We moved all employees and equipment into our manufacturing facility in Warminster, PA, located about an hour outside Philadelphia, so all company divisions operate from the same location, which has helped us streamline processes and improve communication channels.

 By combining ThermOmegaTech's expertise in phase-change technology, thermal actuator design, and valve manufacturing with our newly acquired printed circuit board assembly skills, we have broadened our offering to better support our customers' needs.

 Quality Control is our Top Priority

 Our entire team is dedicated to Lean Manufacturing Initiatives and striving to cultivate a culture of continuous improvement, evidenced by having our Quality Management System (QMS) certified ISO 9001 for over 2 decades and elevating that to reach AS9100D Certification since 2019. ThermOmegaTech also adheres to California's Proposition 65 requirements and meets RoHS and REACH compliance on required projects. Less

Company Description by the company:
Zetwerk is a unique supplier for you and your company as we offer manufacturing capabilities, capacities, and services to support your sourcing and supplier requirements including helping you reduce costs and time to market.

Our unique set of services means Zetwerk can do more than manufacture high-quality components as we can provide assembly, packaging, and our Zetwerk Managed Inventory (ZMI) for JIT deliveries.

We at Zetwerk would like to work with you and supply your company with high-quality production parts and services.

Our globally competitive pricing can reduce production and tooling costs and shorten time-to-market.

- Reduce costs - We can reduce costs of your existing and new production parts.

- Reduce China sourcing - If you are, like many, reducing sourcing in China, Zetwerk is your cost-effective alternative with no increase in production costs and no tariffs!

- JIT with Zetwerk Managed Inventory (ZMI) - We will stock and manage inventory in a warehouse ensuring lead times More... are less than 5 days for production parts (just-in-time) to your dock.

 Zetwerk Benefits

 - Reduced costs - Zetwerk provides globally competitive production and tooling costs.

 - Faster time-to-market - Our shorter lead times enable OEMs to get market sales sooner.

 - High quality - Zetwerk Quality Certified (ZQC). Zetwerk is ISO 9001:2015 and AS 9100D aerospace quality certified. Zetwerk is also ISO 45001:2018, and ISO 14001:2015 certified. Zetwerk suppliers' plants are IATF 16949:2016 automotive quality certified and ISO 13485:2016 medical quality certified. Zetwerk and our suppliers have global quality expertise in FMEA, APQP, PPAP, SPC, MSA, and we support Production Part Approval Process (PPAP) level requirements.

 - JIT with Zetwerk Managed Inventory (ZMI) - We will stock and manage inventory in a warehouse ensuring lead times are less than 5 days for production parts (just-in-time) to your dock.

 - Zetwerk Project Management (ZPM) - Our Project Managers work closely to support and communicate project status on each step of the project from PO to shipment.

 Zetwerk is the global source for world-class manufacturing of high-quality production components and supply chain services. With our manufacturing facilities and those of our supplier partners, Zetwerk has practically unlimited production capabilities and capacities at facilities in India, Southeast Asia, and elsewhere. Company Description by the company:
In 1983 Tri-State Fabricators, Inc., was started by Jay Richard (Dick) Vogt and his three sons Rick, Jeff, and Chris with one overarching goal in mind; to create a metal fabrication company that profoundly cared about creating long-term partnerships with its customers, employees, suppliers, and community.

From its humble beginnings in an old milk factory in Madisonville, Ohio; the family business grew thanks to the sheer hard work, customer-focus, and business-growth over personal-profit mentality. After just a few years the business out-grew this factory and they were forced to relocate to a much larger site in Cincinnati, Ohio.

The paint was barely dry on the new facility before word spread about their unmatched quality and craftsmanship, quick turn-around times, and fair pricing. Before long the Vogt family found themselves flooded with work but yet again out of space. This time they vowed to pick a site that could grow with the needs of their customers.

Now situated on 20-acres in Amelia, More... Ohio - a small suburb of Cincinnati - Tri-State Fabricators has created one of the most state-of-the-art metal fabrication and finishing facilities in the region. With 125,000 square-feet under one roof, it is home to some of the latest metal fabrication technology and finishing equipment on the market. More importantly, however, it is the team of highly dedicated and skilled men and women that make this company a success.

 While much has changed in the business and market over its long history, Tri-State Fabricators remains faithful in preserving the core values that have supported its customers and grown the business so successfully all these years. Less

Company Description by the company:
The 3-Dimensional Services Group is comprised of 3-Dimensional Services, Urgent Plastic Services and Urgent Design & Manufacturing. All three companies are full-service engineering, design and rapid prototyping firms that specialize in producing prototype parts and low-volume production runs for industries such as military, automotive, furniture, medical, communication, biomedical research, energy, household appliances, packaging and toys. 

Embracing and utilizing the most current technologies available, the group provides customers with capabilities to bring your designs to reality. 

Company History Highlights

+ Company founded in 1992. Started with five employees.

+ One of the first applications of laser systems was cutting 3/8 thick armor plate for law enforcement vehicles.

+ In cooperation with Michigan State University, company developed and manufactured portable natural grass playing surfaces in 1992 for use at indoor World Cup soccer matches. Product is designated Turfbox Pallet More... System. From concept to completion, over 1,000,000 pounds of steel were processed in three months.

 + 1995 expansion doubled floor space. Additional equipment included expanded machining and laser processing capabilities plus forming systems. Employment increased to over 150 people.

 + Shortly after expansion, ceiling was raised and foundation set to accommodate acquisition of 7000 ton stamping press, joining a host of other, varying capacity presses and press brakes.

 + Achieved ISO 9001 certification in only eight months, approximately half the average time for design and manufacturing firms.

 + 1997 formed Urgent Plastic Services to handle prototyping plastic components.

 + Achieved QS-9000 compliant certification in August 1998. 

 + Formed Urgent Design & Manufacturing in 2000, a full-service engineering, design and rapid prototyping firm with specialty in assembly and fabrication/ forming.

 + 2004 facilities expansion to bring the total to over 250,000 sq.ft. of prototype and low volume production capability and capacity with over 250 employees.

 + Established European office in 2005 to service extended global market.

 + 2023 established South American office. Less

Company Description by the company:
About Bennett Machine & Stamping Co. 

The difficult made easy with: A modern facility and experienced staff, a complete in-house modern tool room equipped to construct your tools & dies, and/or maintain your existing tools, assuring quality products on time. 

Modern presses having capacities of 260 tons for deep draw applications and up to 400 tons of automatic presses having 200 strokes per minute. Company Description by the company:
Over 30 years ago, Plastikon was established with the mission to be recognized as a world-leading plastic and contract manufacturer. Today, Plastikon continues to provide award-winning services to and plays an "essential part" in many of the world's most successful companies in their respective industries including medical, automotive and electronics. Harnessing state-of-the-art technology and dedicated employees, Plastikon has built a global reputation of exceeding customers' expectations. Our core values are simple: deliver on our commitment to provide the highest quality and value with corporate and social responsibility. In our many years as a Toyota Select Supplier, we have learned and applied the true principles of lean manufacturing, which has enabled us to control and successful growth. Our certified minority status provides another benefit to our valued customers to satisfy minority content initiatives.

Our success, however, requires more than just best-of-breed equipment and technology. More... Our success depends on the Plastikon team, which includes our dedicated employees, consultants and associates at facilities in strategic locations worldwide. We value and empower our team to create and foster a culture that rewards and always practices innovation, excellence and cooperation to benefit customers.

 We've grown from a handful to hundreds of team members and today Plastikon has the capability to be an essential part of your engineering and plastic and contract manufacturing solutions for any company anywhere in the world.

 Plastikon is your ideal manufacturing partner. Our professionalism and proven capabilities will ensure your success, while our minority status will satisfy your corporate suppler diversity content. Everyone at Plastikon remains committed to maintaining our reputation as the best global plastics solution provider. Less

Company Description by the company:
Advanced Industrial is a distributor/fabricator, specializing in high performance plastic shapes and CNC machined components manufactured from high performance plastics and aluminum.

Machining high performance plastics can be challenging. Most plastics are soft and slippery, some are very abrasive and most have internal stress that is released during the machining process. These challenges make tooling selection, work piece orientation and innovative work holding extremely important.

Our creative and proprietary approach allows us to successfully make parts that look almost impossible on paper. We pride ourselves on providing aesthetically pleasing parts that exceed customer specifications.

Company Description by the company:
Driving human progress through engineering.

At Precipart, we engineer possible. From the needle on the first Gramophone, to helping mankind explore Mars, to pioneering parts for robotic surgery, we have helped propel the human race forward for five generations. With our unique combination of engineering, design and manufacturing expertise, we have worked with our clients to turn possibilities into possible.

We are makers as well as dreamers.

We think big but we care about the micro details: from the choice of machine or materials, to our exacting quality control processes, to the energy we put into cracking high volume, large scale production. We dare to dream. And then we make that dream a reality. 

A winning combination.

We deliver on every stage of the journey, from manufacturing of parts, contract manufacturing, assemblies and full instruments, as well as end-to-end engineering solutions. And we do it for the most recognized names in the Medtech, Aerospace, Space and Industrial markets. More... Transforming lives with engineering.

 With locations in the U.S., Switzerland and U.K, as well as a rich network of worldwide strategic partners, we are proud to have been a part of some of the world's most exciting scientific projects and breakthroughs.

 We have worked with Stanford and Oxford Universities to cure diseases with DNA sequencing, we have created state-of-the-art ventilators to help fight Covid and we have launched next-generation orbital rockets.

 And tomorrow? Who knows? That's what we love about engineering. The possibilities are endless. Less

Company Description by Thomasnet: Photo-chemical manufacturing services for stainless steel, steel, aluminum, beryllium copper, brass, bronze, ceramic, copper, exotic metals, Inconel®, Kovar®, molybdenum, nickel alloys and superalloys. Capabilities include photo-chemical etching, photo-chemical machining, electroforming and milling. Secondary services such as bending, coating, deburring, heat treating, plating, polishing, stamping, welding, assembly, cleaning, packaging, shipping and warehousing also provided. Serves the aerospace, automotive, defense, decorative, electronic, medical, semiconductor, sensor, instrument, power generation and filtration industries. ITAR registered.
Company Description by the company:
Engineers and designers in many industries rely on the accuracy, precision and consistency of photo etched precision metal components. Customers in many industries rely on Conard Corporation to provide the quality, service and value that their photo etching applications demand.

As an AS9100C/ISO9001 and ITAR registered small business enterprise, Conard has long-established relationships with leading enterprise-level customers. We are fully cognizant and capable of meeting the most exacting requirements.

Specializing in photochemical manufacturing, Conard employs both photo etching and nickel electroforming processes to deliver precision solutions for increasingly demanding leading technologies.

Nickel electroforming, an additive manufacturing process, can produce parts as thin as .0003" with features less than .001".

Conard produces precisely shaped metal parts, components, and sub-assemblies for the aerospace, computer, electronic, medical, optical, and other industries for technology-driven More... OEM's.

 Photo etching versatility allows the fabrication of parts as small as .020" diameter or up to 24"x60". The process is effective for an extensive array of metal alloys, including stainless, carbon and silicon steels, nickel, nickel-iron and nickel-iron-cobalt alloys, copper, brass, bronze, aluminum, molybdenum, and silver. Material thickness ranges from .001" to .040" in ferrous, .065" in copper and up to .080" in aluminum.

 Photo etching is also the go-to process for fabricating power electronic devices on direct bond copper on ceramic substrates. Medical, industrial and veterinary MRI equipment utilize photo etching to produce copper field and litz magnetic coils. PEM fuel cells in a range of architectures rely on photo etching for stack and cell elements. The range of applications in RF, microwave, and wireless technologies is nearly endless and changing daily. Even comparatively pedestrian industrial applications for shims, gaskets, spacers, retainers, and shields find economical precision solutions in photochemical etching.

 Both chemical etching and electroforming are finding growing applications as technologies are demanding greater power and performance in smaller and smaller packages. The level of complexity and detail that can be achieved with photochemical manufacturing is unmatched by more conventional fabricating processes. Less

Company Description by the company:
MME group is a full-service contract manufacturer with the benefits of in-house contract manufacturing services, including product development and engineering, tooling, molding, assembly, program management, quality management, and inventory management. Clean room manufacturing and assembly. We take responsibility for the production timeline and oversee costs. We also manage low-cost offshore options.

Accountability is the foundation for all deliverables. We approach every program with an engineering mindset and manage every step of the process to ensure we meet the desired outcome. Whether you provide full design or we help engineer it, we manufacture to your specs.

Leave sourcing and managing suppliers to us. The MME team has a strong background in supply chain management (KanBan and JIT). We apply DFMA, FEA and other quality systems to manufacture and test your project. We oversee the program's success from start to finish.

We are a leading ISO 13485:2012 certified and ITAR and FDA registered More... contract manufacturer. We provide services to a range of industries including medical, aerospace, government security and safety, consumer products, consumer electronics and telecommunications.

 MME group has 75,000 sq. ft. of manufacturing space and operates 3 shifts with more than 100 employees. We work with most grades of thermoplastic resins and our presses range from 10 to 750 tons. We operate fully contained presses and assembly in our class 8 (100,000) clean room.

 Our services are coupled with superior cost savings and quality systems managed by team members who deliver exceptional contract manufacturing services.

Company Description by the company:
About Peterson Manufacturing Co., Inc.

Peterson Manufacturing Company is an ISO-9001 manufacturer of precision, deep drawn metal stampings. For over 40 years, Peterson Manufacturing has been forming metal components to meet the needs of the industrial, automotive, and appliance marketplaces. We specialize in cost reduction by converting alternative metal forming processes such as screw machining, tube fabricating, and cold heading to our high-speed transfer press process. Our product line consists of engineered metal stampings, eyelets, ferrules, shells, caps, sleeves, studs, bezels, and housings. These components are found in automobiles, trucks, home and small appliances, gauges, sensors and controls, valves, plumbing accessories, hose assemblies, locks, water sprinklers, and hand tools.

Peterson Manufacturing Company has built customer relationships for over 43 years by providing high-quality parts, superior service, and just-in-time delivery at competitive prices.

Company Description by the company:
Founded in 1990, CSI has a proven track record of providing quality prototype and small-run PCB assemblies as well as complex cables, complete box builds and PCB and mechanical design assistance to the electronics industry. In 1999 CSI was acquired by Electronic Services LLC who brought additional expertise, professionalism, and quality focus to the business. In 2001 CSI was one of the first Indiana manufacturers to be certified to the ISO 9001:2008 standard. In September of 2006, CSI moved its offices and assembly functions to larger facilities to accommodate its present and future growth and to provide for lead-free industry requirements.

CSI has the ability to provide assemblies that meet IPC-A-610D class 1, 2 and 3. We service many industries-consumer products, industrial/instrumentation, medical, military, aerospace and automotive. Each industry demands the highest level of workmanship standards, and CSI has the flexibility, talent, and focus to meet each industry's standards.

The More... center of attention for CSI is its customers. An account manager and product engineer are assigned to each customer to assure the expected outcome for every product that is assembled in our facility. Our business's foundation is built on our ability to offer a combination of technology and a talented team of individuals who have the knowledge to turn this technology into products that meet or exceed our customer's requirements. All of our assembly specialists undergo extensive training with a certified trainer, must pass a certification test and then must maintain targeted quality ratings.

 CSI processes are driven by its internal ERP system. It is our belief that materials management capabilities are an absolute necessity to providing on-time deliveries to our customers. Our system records are controlled by bar code scanning at material staging and at each subsequent work center. Controlling our inventory ensures that the appropriate components will be available and that our customers' deadlines are met.

We are committed to providing you quality products that will meet or exceed your expectation. Company Description by Thomasnet: Manufacturer of standard and custom electrical,electronic, and electro-mechanical products that primarily include cable assemblies, wire harnesses, industrial control panels including UL508A panels, junction boxes, power supplies, power distribution and management systems, solar electric generators, ground support equipment, and special test equipment. Capabilities include designing, engineering, lean manufacturing, prototyping, fabrication, 3D plastic printing, assembly, testing, encapsulation, potting, calibration, refurbishing and repairing. Industries served include aerospace, defense, heavy equipment & industrial machinery, automotive/transportation, power and energy.
Company Description by the company:
CME's key market focus as a supplier includes aerospace, defense, heavy equipment and industrial machinery, automotive/transportation, power and energy. CME holds both AS9100D with ISO 9001:2015 and ISO 17025 QMS registrations. Founded by Dr. Nancy Crews in 1997, for over two decades the company develops, prototypes, and manufactures custom-engineered and build-to-print products, assemblies, and subassemblies for industrial and government customers. CME also provides calibration and repair services for external clients and internal programs. CME operations are conducted in our 49K sq ft facility in Pinellas Park, FL. Since our founding, CME has been a supplier to hi-tech Fortune 500 companies and the Federal government. Today, the majority of our manufacturing operations are for builds of cable assemblies and wire harnesses, industrial control panels, avionics test sets, and custom power supplies for other customer builds. CME also produces our own branded products called the SiteLites™ More... LED work light product family, and solar4® solar generator products. This includes a new STEM training device called solar4STEM. More specifically, our product area related work is concentrated on a wide range of electrical/electronic assemblies, electro-mechanical assemblies such as custom pneumatic/hydraulic assemblies, and industrial/aerospace custom or special test, measurement, diagnostics equipment. From original design to development or build to customer requirements, CME designs and/or builds electronic/electrical assemblies, cable and wire harness assemblies, industrial control panels, special test equipment, power supplies, power distribution equipment, portable solar energy generators, and custom training devices/education apparatus. Engineering core competencies include electronic/electrical and electro-mechanical design engineering, power supply design, component-level test equipment development, SBIR R&D projects, and environmental and EMI product qualification/validation testing. Production core competencies include box builds, wire harness build and test acceptance, soldering, encapsulation/potting.

 In addition to our engineering and manufacturing services, CME maintains an A2LA accredited ISO 17025 calibration lab providing in-house and specialized, third party maintenance/repair and calibration lab services for pressure instrumentation and power distribution equipment. Recently, CME became an OEM approved third-party servicer for a global corporation to support their pressure instrumentation product lines in North America. CME also values community support and education in technical areas, especially in science and engineering. As a result, CME has supported mentoring and science, technology, engineering and math (STEM) education programs. CME recently launched an organic brand for STEM-related, portable solar energy instructional kits called solar4STEM 200 and solar4STEM 50. Less

Serves the aerospace, defense, medical, commercial, cryogenic, dental, electrical, food processing, marine, nuclear, petrochemical, semiconductor, transportation and telecommunications industries. Meets AWS and AMS standards. ITAR registered. NADCAP certified.
Company Description by the company:
Electron Beam Welding is a reliable and cost-effective method of joining a wide range of metals. From pacemakers used in the medical industry to sensors used on fighter aircraft, Electron Beam applications are almost limitless. The welding is performed in a vacuum, therefore welds are clean and free from oxidation. 

Due to the extreme density and precise control of the electrons, high weld "depth to width" ratios can be achieved, up to 20-1 is obtainable. With minimal or no distortion, Electron Beam Welding is often the final step of a production sequence. 

Electron Beam welding can offer advantages such as low heat input, minimal heat affected zone and no part distortion. These attributes make it ideal for the welding of intricate final assembly products or sensors that have delicate instrumentation close to the weld joint. Precise control of the electron beam, high speed and repeatability often makes Electron Beam Welding the only viable solution to a difficult manufacturing problem. More... The comparison of an EB weld versus conventional TIG weld illustrates how it can reduce or eliminate distortion and the need for secondary operations. Electron Beam Welding can also save money by reducing joint preparation costs and repeatable settings reduce the risk of operator error. Less

Providence Enterprise is an electro-mechanical, technology-enhanced, contract manufacturer specializing in electro-mechanical assemblies and value add consumables/disposables for the Medical and Healthcare industry. We specialize in pneumatic or fluid driven systems and our capabilities include tooling, injection molding, SMT, sub-assembly, and finished good assemblies.

We protect your intellectual property. It has always been fundamental to us to protect the interests of our customers and the markets they serve. It is why we have earned the ISO 27001 certification which leads the industry in information security. We share the common interest with all of our current and potential customers around protecting confidential information.

We are driven by core values. Since 1992, Providence Enterprise has been founded on:

* Strategic partnerships - focused on long term strategic partnerships with our customers.

* Protecting our customers' brands - protecting our customer's IP and brand reputation More... during all steps of project engagement.

 * Manufacturing excellence - high quality production along with a full suite of manufacturing capabilities.

 * Innovation - future oriented research and development, manufacturing processes, forward-thinking employees, and state of the art facilities.

 We specialize in manufacturing sub-systems and finished goods assemblies of electro-mechanical products. We are also focused on highly engineered plastics and high volume injection molding. Another technology further developed internally includes light-based technologies.

 We are ethical and have high standards. Our focus is on manufacturing products that improve the quality of life. Company Description by the company:
Keats Manufacturing was founded in 1958 on one simple principle: Build the best product through the best process that will satisfy each customer's needs. Although times and technology have changed the fundamental principle has not.

Keats provides its customers with a team of talented and experienced professional who work together throughout the manufacturing process, from design through production. State-of-the-art technology and modern equipment are a necessity, but it is the people who run the equipment that deliver optimum results.

Precision tooling is the cornerstone of our business. With over 100 four-slide, multislide, and radial machines, Keats can stamp, form, and assemble your most intricate metal parts and wireforms. We manufacture an extensive span of parts for industries ranging from automotive to small appliance to electronics. Keats toolmakers utilize the most advanced technologies, including EDM processes, to manufacture metal stampings of incredible complexity. And because More... each one of the tools we use is manufactured in-house, Keats can ensure an unrivaled level of precision. During the manufacturing process, live in-machine sensors verify that parts are being produced to exact tolerances at virtually the same instant they are made.

 Keats manufacturing was awarded QS-9000 certification on March 31, 1999. QS-9000 certification enhances and compliments our ISO-9002 certification, solidifying and standardizing our quality procedures. Less

Company Description by the company:
"Responsiveness ~ from design to delivery" is the mission at Custom Rubber Corp.

Custom Rubber Corp. is committed to delivering not just quality molded rubber components on time, but also delivering the best customer experience throughout the entire process, for the life of the relationship.

Custom Rubber Corp. works with a wide range of industries; consumer products, appliance, electronics, lawn and garden, material handling, communication, marine, industrial machinery, and oil and gas. CRC manufactures a wide range of molded rubber products; consumer products, gaskets, seals, convoluted boots, custom grommets, and specialty protective covers.

Custom Rubber Corp. is certified to ISO 9001, including design, and offers design and engineering services and assistance.

Rubber is a unique material for designing:

- How much compression is necessary for a good seal?

- What type of material offers the best vibration resistance or will perform best under certain environmental conditions?

- Are there More... any design constraints that make parts unmoldable?

 These are all questions the experts at Custom Rubber Corp. can answer.

 Prototyping services and product development services available for product development assistance. There are a number of different prototyping options available. Custom Rubber Corp., together with strategic partners, can provide prototypes from any of the different processes. All prototyping requires a 3D computer model of the part in question. Custom Rubber Corp. can assist with the creation of a 3D computer model if necessary.

 Custom Rubber Corp. is equipped with injection presses of capacities ranging from 70 ton-500 ton, modern compression and transfer presses, and cryogenic flash removal equipment. Less

Company Description by the company:
Karl Gschwind Machine Works (KGMW) is a well-established manufacturer of high-quality precision machined parts since 1965.

Karl Gschwind Machine Works, originated in Lynn, Massachusetts starting from a one machine shop to our present 12000 square foot building and modern equipment.

Karl Gschwind, grew the company through the years to what it is today by establishing a strong customer base consisting of both small businesses as well as many larger companies. 

In 2012, Karl sold his business to ADC and continued to work for them until 2014 when he decided to retire.

In August of 2020 Michael Benoit purchased the company from ADC, and the company began operating as Karl Gschwind Machine Works, LLC.

Michael Benoit has a long established history with Karl Gschwind Machine Works, LLC having worked for the company for nearly 35 years since he first graduated from high school. Michael has long been the lead man in the lathe department until five years ago when he became the operations manager and More... taking over the day to day responsibilities of running the company.

 Looking towards the future Michael plans to continue to upgrade the equipment and modernize the shop, as he has been doing for the past several years. These improvements will continue to help us diversify and increase our customer base for continued growth. Less

CNC machining, contract manufacturing, welding, shearing, saw cutting, riveting, assembly, lathe work, manual milling, aluminum dip, joint and torch brazing services are available. Company Description by the company:
We have been serving the aerospace, medical, electronics, telecommunication, military, automotive and commercial industries for over 30 years, and have been supplying avionics equipment, wace quide assemblies, x-ray housings, hermetically sealed cases, thermal transfer, systems, ground support equipment and NASA in-flight instrumentation.

Although we specialize in aluminum dip brazing, we also provide services such as silver brazing, heat treating, non destructive testing, certified, welding, grinding, high pressure leak detection and helium mass spectrometry vacuum testing. 

Our expert assistance is available to assist you in fabricating your aluminum dip brazed assemblies, or we will arrange to fabricate the assemblies for you. We can meet your needs in our facility or arrange for one of our valued local suppliers to provide fabrication assistance that you may require.

Company Description by the company:
MBK Tape Solutions, a Boyd Corporation, is a global leader in the tape converting industry. Since 1971, MBK Tape Solutions has custom-designed and manufactured pressure-sensitive adhesive tapes and related products for component parts or end-user products in almost every imaginable industry. 

With access to hundreds of tape suppliers in the world and a huge inventory, the knowledgeable sales team helps find and design the right product for the application. Customer service provides support and communication throughout the process, assuring fast turnaround and high quality.

Using state-of-the-art converting equipment, MBK converts jumbo rolls or sheets of adhesive tapes, films, foams, foils, cloth, and other flexible materials into any size, shape or configuration required. Converting capabilities include die-cutting parts on rolls, sheets, or into individual pieces, specialty slitting and rewinding rolls to any length and size, multi-layer laminating, printing logos and instructions, sheeting More... flexible materials, traverse winding and spooling, tabbing, kitting, and endless other services. ISO Class 8 clean-room manufacturing and packaging are available.

 MBK is ISO-9001:2015 certified and committed to providing quality tape products and services. 

 In 2021, MBK was acquired by Boyd Company, giving access to additional materials and capabilities worldwide. Together, the MBK and Boyd teams offer expertise, experience, and the most advanced technologies, delivering innovative, cost-effective tape and thermal management solutions for our customer's products. Company Description by Thomasnet: ISO 9001:2015 certified. Manufacturer of standard and custom mobile fluid handling carts and dispensing and storage systems. Customized hydraulic fluid reservoirs and tanks are also offered. Made from steel, stainless steel, aluminized steel and aluminum. Serves the aerospace, agricultural, automobile, battery, brewery, paper, healthcare and chemical industries.
Company Description by the company:
The IFH Group (for Innovative Fluid Handling) is the largest manufacturer in the USA of custom steel fuel and hydraulic oil tanks for off-road and specialty vehicles. Applications include combines, heavy terrain forklifts, earth boring equipment, boom cranes, grounds keeping equipment, end loaders and hay bailers. Fuel Tanks and Hydraulic Reservoirs range in capacities from 1 to more than 300 gallons and are manufactured from steel, stainless steel, aluminum or aluminized steel. We offer an engineering staff dedicated to working for you to manufacture a reservoir or tank that not only meets your needs but also is designed with manufacturing in mind. We offer a streamlined production process that will assure you get the best value for your investment. And we offer Assembly Services that allow you to receive a reservoir or tank complete with all the additional equipment you might need.

The IFH Group started doing business in 1945 as King's Weld Shop in Rock Falls, Illinois. Initially, the More... business was a two-man operation. In 1966, the company was incorporated as J.L. King Co., Inc. and occupied 20,000 sq. ft.

 As the company grew, the name of the corporation was changed to Sauk Valley Equipment Company. The company grew to include national and international sales of Lubrication Handling Equipment and marketed to large manufacturing companies. In 1998, the company purchased Deluxe Tank Mfg. and changed the corporate name to The IFH Group, Inc. In 2007, it moved to its present location and now occupies 131,000 sq. ft. of manufacturing space in Rock Falls, IL.

 Through the years, The IFH Group has enjoyed a reputation for quality work and prompt service. Today, The IFH Group is the largest manufacturer of small, customized fuel and hydraulic oil reservoir tanks in the country. Less

Company Description by Thomasnet: Precision rubber molding services. Compression, transfer and injection molding services are available. Materials handled include silicone, Viton®, nitrile, flourosilicone, neoprene, natural rubber, SBR, EPDM, chlorobutyl, FKM, Buna, Hydrin® and butyl. Company Description by the company:
Pure Rubber Products manufactures precision custom rubber parts in most materials, from prototype through production. For your short or long production runs, we offer compression molding, transfer molding and injection molding methods. With over 75 years of experience, we have the expertise to provide consistently high-quality rubber molded parts for all industries. We specialize in small, tight-tolerance parts that require close attention to detail. Our turnkey molding services include a complete machine shop to manufacture tooling and molds, help with the selection of the best material for your part, prototype manufacture and full production runs. We take your drawing and specifications and manufacture the parts you need, when you need them. Our reputation for high quality and fast turnaround is well-earned.Pure Rubber Products is committed to providing the highest quality parts to each client. Our 75 years of experience in the rubber molding industry have provided us with the knowledge More... and expertise to ensure that all parts we manufacture meet the exact requirements of the job, are delivered on time and at a reasonable cost.

 We are ISO 9001:2008 registered and are active members of the Rubber Manufacturers Association (RMA). All our parts meet or exceed the standards set by the RMA for finished products.

 Our experienced staff works with each client to determine the best molding process to use. Molds and tooling are designed and can be manufactured in-house to your specifications for each job. We have partnered with an experienced materials laboratory to help recommend, test and provide the best material for each job. And, we work with each client throughout the design and manufacturing process to ensure that the parts meet the exact requirements of the job.

 Our clients return to Pure Rubber Products because we supply high quality parts, on time and at a reasonable price. Less

Company Description by the company:
Deerfield Machine Parts is a "job shop" manufacturing firm located in Southern New Jersey, just minutes from Philadelphia. We specialize in several different areas including: CNC turning, milling, screw machine work, welding, tube forming, tube bending, light stamping, and grinding. We handle most machining operations in-house, but we also work closely with other manufacturers such as foundries, powdered metal manufacturers, and sheet metal specialists to provide our customers with complete one stop service. We have a nationwide base of customers which includes Mexico as well.

Deerfield Machine Parts was incorporated in 1980 as a job shop to supply automotive parts rebuilders with a high-quality, lower-cost alternative to the companies they were dealing with at the time. We started with metal stamping and formed tubing parts, such as automotive water pump hose connections, rack & pinion steering hydraulic lines and many other types of automotive related tubing products. Over the years we More... have grown to specialize in welding/brazing and CNC turning/milling as well.

 If youre searching for someone to handle your manufacturing needs, someone who can provide quality products on time, at a reasonable cost, look no further than DMP. Less

Company Description by Thomasnet: ISO 9001:2008 certified manufacturer of automotive & heavy duty U bolt muffler clamps & band clamps. Custom manufacturer of industrial grade U bolts, industrial grade bent bolts, wire forms & stampings. Types of bent bolts include flat J-hooks, hooks, J-bolts (round), J-bolts (square), L-hooks, U-bolts (round), U-bolts (square) & V-bolts. Materials such as 304 stainless steel, 409 stainless steel & 1008-1541 mild steel are used. Capabilities include mechanical forming, roll threading, rotary bending, progressive/single die stamping, powder coating, welding, plating, packaging, part number/logo printing, UPC/bar code labeling & prototyping. ANAB accredited. Products are RoHS compliant. Products are made in the USA.
Company Description by the company:
Clamps, Incorporated was founded in 1957 by the late Walter F. Riker with the design and subsequent patent of a heavy-duty guillotine style exhaust clamp used in the heavy-duty truck and off-road equipment markets. The guillotine style clamp has been a great success and is still recognized worldwide for its quality and value. 

The success of the guillotine style clamp and Clamps, Inc. didn't happen by chance. Years of dedicated effort by the Riker family and the employees of Clamps, Inc. past and present, have made the company a world leader in the heavy-duty exhaust clamp marketplace. In 1991, the direction of the company changed and new goals were set with a structured plan for the long term growth of the company. The plan with a goal to diversify the company, products and services offered was initiated. While this challenge has been an on-going effort at Clamps, Inc., the many successes achieved to date have been monumental. 

Paramount among these successes has been in the area of our More... commitment to our quality systems program. Our program has been instituted to help insure to our customers they will receive quality products each and every time they receive a shipment. In February of 1999, Clamps, Inc., through a third-party audit from CRS Registrars, Inc., achieved certification to the standards set forth in ISO 9002. As of October 2003, Clamps Incorporated has successfully achieved ANSI/ISO/ASQ Q9001-2000 certification. With this certification along with the subsequent required surveillance audits conducted by CRS, we feel we can assure our customers that the quality systems in use in our quality program will stay on the leading edge.

 Today, Clamps, Inc. is a recognized leader in the exhaust clamp marketplace offering our customers a complete line of exhaust clamp products, U-bolt clamps, band style clamps and hangers. Clamps, Inc., through our diversified products group, is also playing a leading role in the industrial grade specialty bent bolt market, wire forms and specialty stampings, supplying major customers in the heavy-duty trucks, off-road equipment, agricultural and industrial markets. Less

Moreover, ADI is the leading, global provider of high-performance electronic components, electronic manufacturing services and supply chain solutions. The company sells primarily to tier one and two system integrators in the commercial and military aerospace industries. With six facilities in the US, the UK and India, ADI is well positioned to serve the increasingly global growth of the aerospace market. ADI differentiates itself by having successfully developed an exceptional business model that effectively integrates design, production assembly and logistics solutions for electronic components on a just-in-time basis to the exact location of use for its customers. The efficiencies of ADI's integrated supply chain model provide customers in aerospace, defense, medical, industrial and marine industries with a compelling reason to select More... ADI as their preferred, comprehensive supply chain partner.

 Today, ADI is a global company with strategic capabilities in the following areas:

Company Description by the company:
Founded in 1980, Altraco leverages decades of experience and decades-long factory partnerships, and purchasing power to provide you with quality products and reliable on-time delivery at a compelling price.

Our contract and private label manufacturing customers, including Fortune 500 companies, treat Altraco as their internal sourcing, product manufacturing, quality control department. Some companies don't want to build such a department, some decide to outsource this department and some decide to reduce the size of their department. Altraco is glad to make things easier for you regardless of whether you choose to assign some or all of your SKUs to us.

Because we serve many customers with many SKUs across many industries, Altraco has purchasing power that typically provides you a lower cost than buying direct.

Our manufacturing expertise includes casting, extrusion, assembly, forging, machining, plastic molding, and more.

Company Description by the company:
Alternative Manufacturing Inc, AMI as we are known, is an Electronic Contract Manufacturing company with locations in Central Maine (Winthrop) and Somerville, MA. The two main services that we provide, is building circuit card assemblies (PCBA) and then taking them to their next higher level, providing a box build. AMI also supports some small volume cable manufacturing and repair work.

AMI is unique in that; our process and equipment is set up in such a way that we can cater to lower volume builds that most startups need. Instead of having one or two long production volume lines, AMI has 11 mini lines, which enables us to do small production runs (down to a single pc) and the ability to ramp up to mid-level production runs, mid-level being 50-100K units EAU. 

The benefit of using AMI as a supply partner for a startup, is that we can support ECO changes and product development easily with any customer. Our team here takes on any project with the intent of exceeding expectations; we offer More... support and guidance to the project with the mindset of making the products more producible, as well as cost effective. 

 Over 85% of the startups that AMI has engaged with over the years, are still with us today as they grow towards pre and full production builds. Let us help you with your project! Less

Company Description by the company:
About Rogan Corp. 

It is essential that Rogan Corporation provide the highest possible value to its customers through the on-time delivery of superior quality components at fair market prices. Additionally, through the diligent use of products innovation, continuous improvement, and sound technical and logistical support, Rogan will help each customer achieve profitable success throughout the life of their end products.

Rogan realizes that providing high value to our customers will not only help bring market and financial strength to those customers, but it will do the same for Rogan and our suppliers. In turn, market and financial strength becomes the cornerstone for providing security and opportunity for the employees and the communities of all involved in the supply chain.

Business continues to grow as Rogan now offers a large selection of control knobs, clamping hardware, and custom multi shot and insert molding solutions. Driven by the desire to provide customers with value through More... high quality, productivity gains, more flexible deliveries, and superior design and development assistance, Rogan is poised to continue to grow, prosper, and satisfy its customers for a long time to come. Company Description by Thomasnet: Manufacturer of standard and custom electronic and magnetic components. Products include baluns, coils, subassemblies, harnesses, transformers, solenoids, winders, reactors, filters and inductors. Contract manufacturing, injection molding, prototyping and assembly services are available. Company Description by the company:
Are you an original equipment manufacturer? Are you looking for nearshoring options for your company's PC board components? We are price positioned to outbid traditional offshore facilities (e.g. China, Mexico) with the transport and communication advantages of being close to the U.S. East Coast. A dynamic team is ready to bring you the benefits of quality products, competitive quotes, quick response time, great customer service, and a business culture built on integrity.

Manutech Assembly, Inc. (dba Manutech, Inc.) is a privately held American company incorporated in Delaware in 1984. Manutech's global network consists of a manufacturing home in Haiti, along with subsidiaries in the U.S. and in Europe. Our corporate sales office is located in Miami a short 1.5 hour flight from manufacturing operations in Haiti.

Are you currently outgrowing your capacity to wind your own coils? Look no further. Our product range includes transformers (power transformers, flyback transformers, audio transformers, More... tunable rf transformers, current sense transformers) high frequency magnetics, chokes and inductors, solenoids, wire harness electromechanical assemblies, and a wide range of custom products. 

 We have over 35 years of experience providing high quality, competitively-priced products and sub-contract manufacturing services. We are certified by ISO 9001:2015 standards, and specialize in magnetic components. We work with expertise in offshore electronic assembly of custom designed components for many applications, and provide extensive product testing capabilities. Engineers on staff can help with your design and manufacturing needs. 

 Are you an inventor and need a factory to build products? Get in touch. We can help you with your box builds. You get your finished goods at a great price, without having to go to China or Mexico. 

 Engineers from a wide variety of industries love to work with us. We consistently serve engineered needs from: medical, telecommunications, power conversion and measurement, robotics, military, renewable energy, to industrial and commercial equipment industries. We manufacture and test to ensure high quality components for many applications. 

 We foster job creation in Haiti employing more than 300 employees, and serve customers worldwide. We offer in house training programs to our skilled and dedicated workforce to make your quality products. 

 Make subcontracting with Manutech in Haiti your choice for reliable, friendly, smart, and expert quality service. We are one of a kind. Less

We operate all our plants with a strong focus on quality and continuous improvements. Our quality credentials include: ISO 9001, ISO-14001, ISO-45001, IECQ CQ080000, IATF 16949. We are also an authorized label supplier of UL products.

The industries we serve range from electronics, appliances, computer, medical, automotive, to other general industrial markets. 

We strive to continuously exceeding our customers' expectation and helping them turn designs into reality! 

Contact us for consultation, samples, quotes or prototypes.

A strong commitment to quality and continued dedication resulted in earning the respect and confidence of key US Defense clients. Icon Metalcraft's reputation in the metal crafting industry grew to the point were they had to build their own 50,000 sq. ft. facility in Wood Dale, IL. It is here that Silvia McLain, President, and the Icon Metalcraft family continue with Ron McLain's vision for the company.

Company Description by the company:

Applied Engineering specializes in high precision electro-mechanical builds from complex sub-assemblies to large fully integrated capital equipment. AE is also UL 508A and ITAR Registered.

AE core competencies include an expertise in the manufacturing and build of complex electro-mechanical assemblies, PDUs, control panels, box build, rotary and linear actuators, high precision stages, coils, vacuum components, and optical assemblies. Additionally, AE differentiates itself by providing advanced manufacturing solutions through our new product introduction (NPI) process that More... is tailored to meet the specific needs of our clients. Company Description by Thomasnet: Custom manufacturer of rigid printed circuit boards (PCB) for aerospace, medical, electronics, information technology, defense, military, instrumentation and telecommunication industries. Types include double-sided, multilayered, etched, fabricated, drilled, solder-masked, plated, surface-mounted, electrically-tested, plated-through-hole (PTH), and vacuum-laminated printed circuit boards. Made from glass-reinforced or ceramic-loaded PTFE, polyimide, phenolic resins and polyphenylene oxide materials. Available with Solder Mask Over Bare Copper (SMOBC), Hot Air Solder Leveling (HASL), Electroless Nickel Immersion Gold (ENIG), lead-free, immersion silver, and electroless tin finishes. Prototyping services are also offered. Medium production volume is available. RoHS compliant. UL listed.
Company Description by the company:
Standard Printed Circuits, Inc. is an independently owned manufacturer of printed circuit boards located in Sherburne, New York. Sherburne, a small town of 1500, is positioned almost equi-distant from the major manufacturing centers of Syracuse, Utica and Binghamton, NY. 

Standard specializes in delivering quick turn prototypes, pre-production and medium volume production orders, on time, and with the highest level of commitment to our customers. Our products include 1-14 layers utilizing standard FR4, High Temperature, and RF materials. 

Since it's inception, Standard Printed Circuits, Inc. has continued to grow and currently serves over 150 customers nationwide. During the last 35 years of operation, SPC has provided PCBs to such well known companies/research facilities as IBM, General Electric, Emerson Electric, Savin, Hercules Aerospace, BF Goodrich Aerospace, Magnavox, Thomson Consumer Products, Teledyne Avionics, Bendix, Amphenol, Welch-Allyn Medical, SCI, Cornell University (Nuclear More... Sciences), and (Arecibo Observatory), University of Missouri, Rutgers University and many smaller OEMS, contract manufacturers, and design houses. Continued growth is the primary focus of corporate management's current efforts.

 FR4 1 to10 layer PCBs constitutes 70% of the product manufactured by Standard with the remaining 30% allocated for processing commercial RF/Microwave application PCBs. Since 1988, Standard Printed Circuits, Inc. has been building on its experience and continues to service the growing demand for commercial microwave products. Less

Elmgrove Technologies is a contract electronics manufacturer (CEM) based in Rochester, New York specializing in the design, assembly, and repair of printed circuit boards (PCBs) and other electromechanical devices.

Family-owned since our inception in 1971, Elmgrove Technologies has been providing quality products and superior customer service to companies like yours for over 40 years.

What We Do:

As an experienced, full-service CEM, Elmgrove Technologies understands the nuances involved in the development and manufacture of a successful product. From prototype to production, our knowledgeable staff is here to answer any questions and to guide you through the process every step of the way, offering services which include (but are not limited to):

 PCB Design

 PCB Fabrication/Assembly

 Electromechanical Assembly/Box Builds

 Rapid Prototype Assembly

 Production Assembly

 Repairs/Rework/Modifications

 Materials Sourcing

 Engineering Support Services

Why It Matters:

Elmgrove Technologies realizes More... that our success is dependent upon your success. As such, we go the extra mile required to deliver a quality product on time, every time.

 By choosing to partner with Elmgrove Technologies, your organization will benefit from the best of both worlds-that is, the responsiveness, flexibility, and attention to detail of a small business combined with the services and capabilities typically associated with much larger firms.

 In addition to quality products/services, quick turnaround, and competitive pricing, Elmgrove Technologies is firmly committed to providing total customer satisfaction with each and every order. This is not just a line in a sales pitch; its our promise, and we look forward to earning your trust. Less

Company Description by the company:
Engineering Graphics is celebrating over 35 years of printed circuit design and prototype development services. Incorporated in 1982, the company has designed and built thousands of printed circuit boards for nearly 200 clients in the United States and foreign countries. These thousands of unique designs have replicated into hundreds of thousands of circuit boards that are at this moment performing their functions in medical devices, test and measurement instrumentation, material handling systems, industrial controls, navigation and guidance equipment, telecommunications, space exploration, and defense electronics.

Engineering Graphics, since its inception, has always invested in state of the art software and tools beginning with Gerber workstations, Cadnetix workstations, and pads power PCB workstations. Our current design systems are the Altium designer workstations, National instruments design suite workstation, and Veribest (Mentor graphics). Investment in these state of the art solutions More... has positioned Engineering Graphics as a highly respected, technologically-advanced design and prototyping service. They work closely serving electronic product manufacturers, educational institutions, and research and development facilities.

 Engineering Graphics provides computer-assisted printed circuit design, fabrication, and assembly. They work in accordance with IPC standards.

 Engineering Graphics has been honored to assist both the small entrepreneurial start-up companies and very large organizations. A few of the clients we served include AirGas, Alcoa, AT&T, Bayer, Bechtel Bettis, Cutler-Hammer, GE, Kodak, Lucent Technologies, NASA, Phillips Nuclear Medicine, PPG, Rockwell, Siemens Medical, United Technologies, and Westinghouse.

 Engineering Graphics is a class "A" design/build firm with a substantial amount of experience in printed circuit board design, fabrication and assembly technologies. Less

Company Description by the company:
Empowered teams, delivering quality, on-time.

Unlimited Services is a privately held company with headquarters in Oconto, Wisconsin. We are a financially sound company and currently celebrating over 22 years of operation. We are a major presence in the value-added business of custom wire harness, cable and control panel assemblies for off-road equipment, emergency, heavy duty truck and telecommunications industries.

In 2001 we expanded our Oconto, WI. facility to over 63,000 square feet to accommodate our growing business and provide the necessary resources to our customers. In 2003, we purchased the operating assets of Trans World Connections, Ltd., including manufacturing operations in Lynchburg, Virginia and Guaymas, Mexico. These locations operate as Trans World Connections, a division of Unlimited Services. The combined capabilities and synergies of both organizations have resulted in an expanded organization that will continue to provide the resources necessary to support the needs More... of our customers.

 The greatest distinction we have from most of the other companies in our industry is our progressive philosophy and pragmatic implementation of lean and flow manufacturing concepts. We have implemented flow visual systems, JIT, Kanban, TQM, teams, empowered workforce and gainsharing programs to ensure that we can deliver a quality product on-time to our customers. We were nominated in 1997 for a Wisconsin Manufacturer of the Year award in recognition for our successful implementation of these progressive philosophies. Our well-trained and low cost labor force situated in a small communities and Mexico ensures us of adequate human resources to support our growth and our customers.

 Our commitment to continuous improvement with our customers has allowed us to continue to grow and be a valued supply partner. Unlimited Services was featured in an issue of the Wiring Harness News, the paper that acts as the voice of the electrical harness and cable business in the US. It highlights our commitment to teamwork and to complete customer focus as our strategy for success in serving our customers. Less

Company Description by the company:
Since Kirsan Engineering first opened its doors in 1967, we have evolved from a small, family-owned custom mold and die builder into a diversified contract manufacturer of precision-machined components. Over the years, state-of-the-art equipment has allowed Kirsan to consistently meet the ever-changing needs of todays complex and competitive global marketplace.

In 2001, Kirsan was acquired by Ocenco, Inc, bringing new assets and resources in-house and further enhancing our ability to provide reliable services and innovative solutions to a wide variety of diverse industries. Today, a growing list of customers  in demanding markets such as aerospace, agriculture, automotive, government, hydraulic/flow control, medical, military, mining, petroleum and transportation  look to Kirsan to meet their complete precision-machined component needs.

Company Description by Thomasnet: ISO 9001:2015 and ISO 13485:2016 certified custom contract manufacturer of wire harnesses, cable assemblies, printed circuit board assemblies (PCBA's / CCA's) and electronic box builds. Capabilities and services include plastic and aluminum injection molding, DFM engineering, die casting, precision machining, cutting, crimping, stripping, terminating, twisting, heat shrinking, tinning, labeling/marking, spiral wrapping, butt splicing and soldering. Company Description by the company:
ICTC is an ISO 9001:2015 and ISO 13485-2016 certified, full-service Global Manufacturing Solutions provider that specializes in low volume, high-mix cable, and wire harness assemblies, electronic box builds, PCB assemblies and turn-key services to OEM's worldwide.

With its headquarters and factory located in Brooksville, Florida, office locations in Changan, China; and another factory location in Laguna, Philippines, the company was established in 1988 to provide the rapidly growing electronics market with the highest quality cable assemblies and electronic box builds and has become a reliable partner to manufacturers in over a dozen industries, including aerospace, audio/video, automotive, commercial, datacom, gaming, industrial machinery, lighting, medical, military, renewable energy, and telecom. ICTC has become an integral partner with some of the most respected private and public companies partly due to its time-tested manufacturing capabilities, which range from prototyping to complete More... turnkey contract manufacturing.

 ICTC is part of the IC Intracom group of companies with locations in 12 countries around the world, which allow the leveraging of these strategic partnerships in order to provide client-specific manufacturing solutions that are value-driven with excellent service, superior quality, and with an ultimate goal of exceeding customer expectations. Customers are assured to find high quality, reliable partner in ICTC due to its investment in long-term growth with automated equipment and skilled employees.

 Our approach: ICTC's time tested manufacturing skills and talents allows us to exceed our customers' expectations by developing client-specific manufacturing solutions that are value-driven with excellence in service, on-time delivery and superior quality.

 Mission statement: To provide the best customer experience through innovative manufacturing solutions.

 Vision statement: Redefine contract manufacturing by being trusted, friendly and flexible.

 Values: (I) Integrity - (C) Collaborate - (T) Thrive - (C) Create Less

Company Description by the company:
Universal Metal Marking Co. (UMMCO) is one of the largest and most diversified metal marking companies in the U.S. Founded in 1975, UMMCO is located in Paramount, CA and serves over 300 customers in 24 different industries in over 40 states and internationally, including Asia, Europe, and the Americas.

UMMCO is an AS 9003 certified corporation offering over 30 different marking services Since acquiring Paramount Stamp Works in 1983, UMMCO also provides over 20 different inspection stamps and marking devices. For nearly four decades, customers consistently turn to UMMCO as the leading expert in the marking industry. 

UMMCO is the definition of Value-Add. In many instances, customers all over the world see UMMCO as an extension of their businesses. Customers do not have to outlay unnecessary capital, time and energy to mark parts that have strict marking requirements. Instead, they repeatedly send their parts to UMMCO, knowing they will be Marked Correctly, Delivered Quickly, and Priced Reasonably. More... As the most trusted and most diversified company in the metal marking industry, UMMCO is the Only one-stop shop for all your marking needs. 

 No other company has the RANGE of UMMCO in the following categories:

 Number of Marking Methods: 32 (including Laser Etching, CNC Engraving, Electrochemical Etching, Roll Stamping, Hot Stamping, Knurling, Dot Peening, Vibro Peening, Diamond Scribing, Pad Printing, Ink Marking, Silkscreening and Die Manufacturing).

 Number of Customers: 300+

 Number of Industries: 25+ (including Aerospace, Military, Defense, Oil & Gas, Medical Equipment, Auto, Industrial, Retail, Wineries, Entertainment, Food & Beverage, Utilities, Chemicals, Government, Agricultural, Fashion, Textiles, Construction, Steel Fabrication, and Telecom).

 Size of Customers: Sole Proprietors to Fortune 500 Companies.

 Quality Tolerances: General marking instructions to 0.001" in strict Aerospace Specs.

 Number of Specifications Marked to: 1,000+ (complete Specifications List on website).

 Geographical Reach: Over 40 states and internationally, including Asia, Europe, and the Americas.

 Production Job Quantities: One piece runs to millions per run.

 Production Part Weight: 2 ounces to over 2,000 lbs.

 Production Part Dimensions: 0.125" diameter caps to 30 feet long aerospace parts.

 Lead Times: Next day delivery to monthly releases spanning over 1 year. Less

Company Description by the company:
Global Supplier of Molded Rubber Parts, Seals & More

Founded in 1982, Ace Seal is a Woman Owned supplier of O-rings, Rubber Seals, Gaskets, Custom Molded Rubber parts with global reach. Headquarters are located in the heart of Silicon Valley with worldwide ISO / TS 16949-2002 certified manufacturing facilities that allow us to give you the very best quality, price, and lead-time available in the industry.

Ace Seal continuously upgrades tooling and process technologies to insure that we are one of the world leaders in manufacturing of O-Rings, Rubber Seals and Molded Rubber Parts. Our single and multi-cavity tooling produces parts designed to your exact tight tolerances that can be molded from commercial or ASTM/MIL compounds. Our low cost tooling and quick turnaround satisfies the most demanding engineering and manufacturing teams and is a reason we are a top global o-ring supplier. Whether you need small quantities or high volume production runs, call Ace Seal for your custom molded rubber More... & plastic components.

 At Ace Seal our O-Rings are available in both U.S. and Metric sizes. We offer O-Rings and other seals in Nitrile, Viton, Silicone, Ethylene Propylene, Teflon and several other materials. Company Description by the company:
Our business at Aggressive Engineering Corp is moving metal into complex configurations, over and over again, each time the same as before, producing medium to massive quantities of metal parts.

We make products for industry that often no other supplier can match for configuration, quality and cost-effectiveness.

We are proud of the capability we have developed in engineering know-how, in producing complicated configurations, in manufacturing in large volumes to precise tolerances, in quality control, and in solving problems for customers.

We know metal and how to work with it - forming, drawing, extruding, etc. We employ a broad spectrum of alloys, and are capable of producing a wide variety of shapes and sizes.

We deliver only "firsts". The last product we make is as precise as the first and each in between. Our people see to that with the tools we have installed for effective quality control and testing of parts we produce. We know there is no substitute for perfection. On an average More... day, we produce thousands of units of finished product of different sorts. We accomplish this day in and day out, year round, comfortably, dependably.

 Perhaps you require more reliability or a more affordable cost. Perhaps it's a new product or an application that previously had been manufactured in some less advanced way. Perhaps it's an idea no one has dared try before!

 Much of our achievement began with challenges just like yours - and resulted in our finding the way to manufacture uniform products that do their job well. Our more important product is a service to you - the security of getting your job done efficiently, reliably and cost-effectively. Less

At TMF Incorporated we specialize in short run, single piece and low volume production quantities of products all made in the USA. Company Description by the company:
We offer custom machine building capabilities, specializing in complete systems for modern manufacturing processes. We provide a one-stop equipment solution, from design to concept to fabrication, installation, and start up. Our expertise spans from simple machine production to the development of complex automated systems. We are experienced with both stand-alone machines and complete integrated systems. Flexible and modular machinery types are offered for systems with anticipated reconfigurations and expansions. Our team of design, mechanical, and electrical engineers consult with customers to understand their processes and goals in order to create machinery to specific requirements. 

Our precision CNC machining capabilities, have allowed us to produce high precision parts and components for customers in a range of industries. We operate a state-of-the-art facility that is equipped with advanced machining systems including engine lathes, CNC lathes and mills with 3 and 4 axis capabilities; More... we also provide CAM programming and CAD design services. With us as a production partner and the use of our contract manufacturing services, our customers maintain a competitive edge - reduced overhead and predicable costs are realized, while top quality products are delivered to their end users. From small component parts to complete machines we offer concept to completion service, including in house engineering assistance, prototyping, various secondary processes, and inventory management. 

 We are also pleased to offer machinery makeover services, which are designed to extend equipment lifecycle. Machines can be retrofitted and reconditioned in order to meet changing manufacturing needs and industry standards. Additional value added services include repair, technical support, documentation, integrations, and project management. Less

Company Description by Thomasnet: Specializing in contract manufacturing services including plastic injection molding, pad printing, design, and engineering. Clamping forces for injection molding ranges from 25 to 200 tons and printing tolerance up to 0.01 in. Company Description by the company:
From concept to production to assembly and decoration, Amdek, Inc. has the expertise and track record to handle all projects, big and small. Amdek specializes in engineered product design, tooling and high-precision injection molding coupled with a full range of secondary assembly and decorating processes.

Amdek, Inc. originated in 1991 by Robert Tetzlaff, the son of a naturalized citizen Roger W. Tetzlaff, who immigrated to the United States in 1949 as an indentured servant. Robert was trained in the "old world school", meaning if you ran or sold a machine, you learned how to build one. He went to Germany for 10 months as an apprentice at Battenfeld GMBH to learn all aspects of building a molding machine.

Robert started on the ground floor of pad printing as an independent sales representative in the early 1980s when ITW Trans Tech came to the United States. This position allowed him the privilege of working with and learning from hundreds of companies and a vast array of manufacturing, More... quality and large-scale production processes. The 30+ years of experience, knowledge and practice has enabled Amdek to offer unique solutions for the most difficult of projects.

 More recently, Amdek Inc. purchased Dave Shepard Enterprises in Hillsboro, OR. We are headquartered in Somerville, AL, with additional decorating facilities in Baileyton, AL and Newberg, Oregon.

 The Amdek team takes pride in almost 30 years of hands-on-service, old-world values, superior products, start-up assistance, and pure loyalty and dedication to all their customers. Less

Company Description by the company:
Established in 1982, HI-Q.A. Inc. is a third generation family owned and operated manufacturing facility. We are located minutes away from Ottawa, Ontario. The region also known as Silicon Valley North.

Our company name is derived from one of our guiding principles - "high quality" - and it serves as a focus in every aspect of our business.

What once began as a small job shop quickly expanded into a full turnkey and system integration facility and HI-Q.A. plans to continue to expand our services.

From small volume to large volume, we offer top quality services with excellent prices in:

- PCB assembly and mechanical assembly

- Consigned electronic manufacturing

- Turnkey electronic manufacturing

- Our world-class MRI preamp component - our own product module

- Integration and test

- Complete packaged solutions shipped direct

- other services - inquire

At HI-Q.A., we recognize the importance of corporate sponsors in community events and we are regular participants in many local activities More... including parades, festivals and many fundraising events. We are proud to display many of our certificates and plaques of recognition in our front lobby and we welcome all of our customers to join in the fun. Less
